snippet: The head of its commercial aircraft division said that failure to keep the bank running would place Boeing at an unbeatable disadvantage to Airbus.
abstract: Boeing's commercial aircraft chief executive Raymond L Conner says he remains optimistic that Congress will reauthorize funding to the Export-Import Bank, which guarantees billions of dollars in loans to foreign buyers of its airplanes; notes that failure to keep bank running would risk American jobs and put Boeing at an unbeatable disadvantage to Airbus, which receives similar support from European governments.
lead_paragraph: The head of its commercial aircraft division said that failure to keep the bank running would place Boeing at an unbeatable disadvantage to Airbus.

headline.main: Boeing Optimistic That Export-Import Bank Will Get Funding
headline.print_headline: Boeing Optimistic Congress Will Renew Financing for Export-Import Bank
